If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed, shoot me an email at info at southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church. Remember, don't give up, trust God, search for answers. Thank you.

in scripture, like don't come to God with your doubts. Don't come to him with your questions.
We talked about Thomas last time, who was just honest. Yep. You know, so I think of twice Paul
does this once with Thessalonians and the Thessalonians are for the Thessalonians. And then
I'm not sure off top of my head where the other one is. But when he's talking to Thessalonians and
he's saying, don't despise prophecies. In other words, don't throw them away automatically,
but test everything, hold fast to what is good. And that that's, by the way, that the Greek word
there test that's documos. Yep. And so too, that's the root of it anyway. But the test it don't,
this is, this is the story right before I told it that I was referencing in, I think the Berean
church is right before the Athens church. It's very soon before that. You're right. When it talks
about the, it's a church that Paul comes and preaches and he teaches and when he gets done, they all go,
all right, we'll go home and check. Yep. And so they go gather and they get copies of the,
apparently of the scriptures and they test everything Paul says and they're honored.
This isn't what's our, what's amazing to me is how often people walk away from Christian teaching,
saying, you know, somehow doubt is a lack of faith or doubt is sin or doubt is, I'm like,
I'm like, here, here's my Bible. Show me. Yeah. Find me an example of that with,
especially in the new Testament, find me any example that you could even twist to say that.
And I just don't think it's there. Yeah. So our faith is not dependent on our knowledge.
That would be Gnosticism. Our faith is a, is a gift that we can have and we can reasonably
evidentially, that's a real word or not, we'll go with it. And we can believe, we can accept and we
can believe based on that. Yeah. And even if you read an Acts at the very beginning, it says, and
Paul went in as was his custom to the synagogue there. And on three Sabbath days, he reasoned with
them from the scriptures, explaining and proving that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and
rise from the dead. And he convinced people they needed the same thing in Athens where he's
reasoning, he's proving he's giving evidence. Not just saying, trust me, like he's actually saying
there's reason to what I'm telling you. There's, there's evidence to back this up.
Thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed Faith. If you enjoyed what you
heard or were challenged, please leave us a review. It'll help other people find us.
If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed, shoot me an email at info at
southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church.
Remember, don't give up, trust God, search for answers.
Thank you.
